title: Sri Lanka exhumes remains to identify ‘Sara Jasmin’
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is exhuming remains of a group of persons who suicide bomb blast in Sainthamaruthu in Ampara to carry out a DNA test to identify ‘Sara Jasmin’, the wife of one of the 2019 Easter Sunday bombers, police said
Pulasthini Mahendran also known as Sara Jasmin was the wife of Mohammed Hasthun, the suicide bomber suspected to have attacked Katuwapitiya church on April 19.
On April 26, she was said to have been one of 17 who died in a safe house in Sainthamaruthu in Ampara while authorities were searching for the families of suicide bombers.
“Though there were two investigations it was not finally proved by DNA evidence,” Police said in a statement.
“Therefore investigators sought permission from Magistrate Courts to exhume the body.”

There has been speculation that ‘Sara Jasmin’ had been spirited away to India. A witness at a Presidential Commission of Inquiry had reportedly said that she could have tipped off Indian intelligence about the impending attack. (Colombo/Apr27/2022)
